class_notes:
(Same as ENG 489 1)
Topic Title: Audacious Women


This course explores 19th-21st century Black women's writing. We will examine how Black women writers have grappled with issues of race, gender, identity, sexuality and citizenship, as well as how forms of literary audacity function within and across these works. As such, we will interrogate texts at the levels of formal, or aesthetic production, their political and social valences, and their cultural receptions and afterlives. We will ask what constitutes Black women's audacity (in all its registers: loudness, boldness, spunk, grit, defiance, sassiness, unconventionality, etc.) in the public imaginary.
course_description: Course focuses on the works of 19th and 20th century black women writers. Writers vary but may include the works of Harriet Jacobs,Pauline Hopkins, Zora Neale Hurston, Toni Morrison, Alice Walker, Gloria Naylor.
